author: Arsene Lupin III
subject: OK, I'll stay... read this please.
body:
About what Luis said earlier...

>Should have qualified that statement.  I meant that someone who writes
you
>to tell gripe specifically about your sig (which is what the original
post
>seemed to indicate) is basically being a jerk IMO.  If you want to
discuss
>or complain about dubbing in general, be my guest, but don't jot a note
to
>someone griping about their sig.  Maybe I am being the jerk here and
>misunderstanding what the original post meant and stuffing my foot
farther
>down my throat. :)

BTW, that is accurate... and exactly why I was upset, I mean, it's like
she didn't even read the original message, for crying out loud!! (Which
happened to be about Lupin's new NTV name, thank you...)

Also, sorry I haven't updated my website since the 17th. I have no real
way to get at it. as I can't use NetZero (since Juno doesn't require
Dial-Up Networking, it's the only modem-based program I've been able to
operate). But then, most of you probably haven't even visited it yet. 

Oh, and Valerie, apparent from your response to my calm fury...

>Anyway, you don't have to get in such a huff about no one posting....

...you pretty much missed the point. Maybe you should read it again (w/o
the parenthesesed sub-topics):

>Besides, I don't think anyone except Luis Cruz and Bruce Osborne even
listens to what I say on this barren >ML, because the only responses I
get are... "that's your .sig quote? Dubs are evil." or a complete change
of >topic that completely ignores my original question. I came seeking
for... no, ~pleading~ for guidance and >answers, but what I mostly got
was shame and the shoulder.

Get it now? 

By the way, has anyone here even *heard* of "Mystery Science Theater
3000"? It ran for 10 years, you know...

Here's my website, for all to see...

TalesoftheWolf@Juno.com : Lupin the Third website is at:
http://www.geocities.com/Tokyo/Market/8050/
"Who can put a value on human life? I mean, who decides who lives and who
dies?"
"I do. Remember? I called dibs."
-Joel and Crow T. Robot, MST3K
